definition: dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
arms and confusion (idiom); turmoil of war

sentences.english: I don't believe you. Why are you here, Private Gordon?
sentences.chinese: 我不相信。你爲什麼來這兒，二等兵戈登？

sentences.english: Otherwise, you are foolish by the side of the teacher body, never be stained with weapons.
sentences.chinese: 否則，你就呆在師父身旁，永不沾兵戈。

sentences.english: I think there are not yet many countries dare to fight with Russian in the world.
sentences.chinese: 本人想這個世界上還沒有幾個國度敢和俄羅斯兵戈。

sentences.english: I think the world has not yet dare to several countries and Russia to fight.
sentences.chinese: 本人想這個世界上還沒有幾個國度敢和俄羅斯兵戈。

sentences.english: Why are you here, Private Gordon?
sentences.chinese: 你來這兒是幹什麼的，二等兵戈登？

definition: fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
to go on or send a punitive expedition
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
smoke signal indicating the presence of hostile forces
